Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
üêõ FIX: Add complete language mapping for word sets filter

Added missing language codes to langMap in /api/word-sets endpoint:
- ar \(arabic\)
- zh \(chinese\)
- ko \(korean\)
- pl \(polish\)
- ro \(romanian\)
- sr \(serbian\)
- tr \(turkish\)

This fixes the issue where word sets were not showing for users
with these language pairs \(e.g., test_de_es, test_ar_en, etc.\)

Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
üêõ FIX: Reset progress function calling non-existent methods

Fixed TypeError in resetAllWordsToStudying\(\) where it was calling:
- this.loadWords\(\) - method doesn''t exist
- this.renderWords\(\) - method doesn''t exist

Replaced with:
- this.updateWordLists\(\) - correct method to reload word lists
- Removed this.renderWords\(\) call as updateWordLists handles rendering

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
üî• FEATURE: Reset progress now DELETES all words instead of resetting status

Changed resetAllWordsToStudying\(\) behavior:
- Previously: Reset words to "studying" status \(kept words\)
- Now: DELETE all words and progress data \(complete reset\)

Frontend changes \(app.js\):
- Updated confirmation message to warn about deletion
- Changed API endpoint from /api/words/bulk/reset-to-studying \(PUT\) to /api/words/all \(DELETE\)
- Updated success/error messages to reflect deletion

Backend changes \(server-postgresql.js\):
- Enhanced /api/words/all endpoint to delete from BOTH tables:
  * words table \(old architecture\)
  * user_word_progress table \(new architecture\)
- Returns detailed count: wordsDeleted + progressDeleted

This gives users a true "fresh start" by removing all data for the selected language pair.

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
üêõ FIX: Handle missing translation column in _from_XX tables

Fixed API error "column tt.translation does not exist" for language pairs
using new architecture \(DE‚ÜíES, DE‚ÜíFR, etc.\) with _from_XX translation tables.

Changes:
- For tables like target_translations_spanish_from_de, translation now comes
  from target word table \(tw.word\) via JOIN instead of tt.translation
- Example translations use tw.example_{lang} from target language table
- Separate query paths for old vs new table architectures
- Adjusted query parameters to exclude source_lang for _from_XX tables

Fixes issue where users with DE‚ÜíES, DE‚ÜíFR pairs couldn''t see their words
in Statistics page due to 500 errors.

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
üêõ FIX: Correct language pair code for word sets

Problem: Users learning language X from language Y were seeing word sets
in the wrong language. For example, en‚Üíes users saw English word sets
instead of Spanish word sets.

Root cause: Frontend was sending languagePair as "fromLang-toLang" but
backend interprets the FIRST part as the learning language.

Fix: Changed public/word-lists-ui.js line 184 to send "toLang-fromLang"

Example:
- Before: en‚Üíes user sends "en-es" ‚Üí sees English sets ‚ùå
- After: en‚Üíes user sends "es-en" ‚Üí sees Spanish sets ‚úÖ

This fixes user 62''s issue where quiz showed words in wrong language.

ü§ñ Generated with Claude Code

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
üîß CONFIG: Disable automatic translation worker on Railway

All translations are now complete in the database. The automatic
translation worker was running every 3 hours but finding 0 words
to translate each time, unnecessarily consuming resources and
cluttering logs.

The translation scripts remain available for manual execution
if needed via npm run translate:matrix.

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
‚ú® FEATURE: Add proper pluralization support for all languages

Problem:
- Statistics page showed "[days]" instead of proper translations
- No pluralization system for handling different language forms
- Different languages have different plural rules \(EN: 2 forms, RU: 3 forms\)

Solution:
1. Added pluralization system to i18n.js:
   - plural\(key, count\) method for automatic plural form selection
   - getPluralFormIndex\(\) with language-specific rules for:
     * English, German, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese \(2 forms\)
     * Russian, Ukrainian, Serbian, Polish \(3 forms: –æ–¥–∏–Ω, –¥–≤–∞/—Ç—Ä–∏, –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ\)
     * Hindi, Arabic, French, Turkish, Romanian \(language-specific\)
   - Added Hindi \(''hi''\) to supported languages list

2. Added plural translation keys to source-texts.json:
   - day \(singular: –¥–µ–Ω—å, day, ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®\)
   - day_few \(2-4 form for Slavic: –¥–Ω—è\)
   - day_other \(plural: –¥–Ω–µ–π, days, ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®\)
   - All forms for 15 supported languages

3. Updated code to use pluralization:
   - gamification.js: streak display now uses i18n.plural\(''day'', count\)
   - features-ui.js: freeze days use proper pluralization

Examples:
- EN: 1 day, 2 days, 21 days
- RU: 1 –¥–µ–Ω—å, 2 –¥–Ω—è, 5 –¥–Ω–µ–π, 21 –¥–µ–Ω—å, 22 –¥–Ω—è
- HI: 1 ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®, 2 ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®, 5 ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
üêõ FIX: Quiz validation for Hindi and non-Latin scripts

Fixed critical bug where Hindi quiz answers were incorrectly validated.
Previously, the normalization function removed non-Latin characters,
causing all answers to be accepted as correct.

Changes:
- Added detection for non-Latin scripts \(Hindi/Devanagari, Arabic, Cyrillic, Chinese, Japanese\)
- Language-aware normalization: preserve non-Latin characters, only normalize whitespace
- Conditional validation: skip German-specific checks for non-Latin scripts
- Stricter typo tolerance for non-Latin languages \(1 char vs 20% for Latin\)
- Added comprehensive test suite with 7 test cases

Fixes issue where user 87''s Hindi quiz accepted any answer as correct.

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
